data.question: What is the highest ligation number reported for the ethynide moiety in the p-phenylenediethynide ligand?
data.answer: The highest ligation number reported for the ethynide moiety in the p-phenylenediethynide ligand is higher than three.

data.question: What structural feature is unique to the crystal structure of compound 1?
data.answer: The crystal structure of compound 1 features an unprecedented μ5-η1 mode for the ethynide moiety within a square-pyramidal Ag5 basket.

data.question: How does the synthesis of [Ag2(p-C≡CC6H4C≡C)]n 4 begin?
data.answer: The synthesis of [Ag2(p-C≡CC6H4C≡C)]n 4 begins with cooling THF to –78 °C and adding n-BuLi.

data.question: What is the role of AgCF3CO2 in the synthesis of compound 1?
data.answer: AgCF3CO2 is used in the crystallization process to obtain compound 1 from the corresponding polymeric crude compound.

data.question: Is the μ8-coordination mode observed in the synthesis of silver(I) 1,3-butadiynediide unprecedented?
data.answer: True

data.question: Does the synthesis of [Ag2(m-C≡CC6H4C≡C)]n 5 require the use of liquid ammonia?
data.answer: False

data.question: What is the melting point range of compound 3?
data.answer: The melting point range of compound 3 is from 220.4 ºC to 223.5 ºC.

data.question: What structural feature distinguishes the crystal structure of compound 2?
data.answer: The crystal structure of compound 2 is distinguished by different terminal ethynide bonding modes, namely, μ4-η1,η1,η1,η1 and μ4-η1,η1,η1,η2.

data.question: Are silver(I) layers linked by ancillary organic connectors abundant?
data.answer: True

data.question: Does the synthesis of [Ag2(o-C≡CC6H4C≡C)]n 6 involve a reaction with AgNO3?
data.answer: True

data.question: What is the yield of compound 1?
data.answer: The yield of compound 1 is approximately 30%.

data.question: What causes the formation of a broken silver(I) double chain in compound 1?
data.answer: The formation of a broken silver(I) double chain in compound 1 is caused by the connection of Ag14 aggregates through argentophilic interaction and continuous π−π stacking.

data.question: Is the μ5-η1 coordination mode for the ethynide moiety observed for the first time in compound 1?
data.answer: True

data.question: Does the synthesis of [Ag2(m-C≡CC6H4C≡C)]n 5 result in a dark-brown powdery form?
data.answer: True

data.question: What is the empirical formula of compound 1?
data.answer: The empirical formula of compound 1 is C56H30F33O22N6Ag15.

data.question: What is the significance of the μ8-coordination mode in the synthesis of silver(I) 1,3-butadiynediide?
data.answer: The μ8-coordination mode in the synthesis of silver(I) 1,3-butadiynediide suggests that the Ag4⊂ C2—C2 ⊃Ag4 moiety may be conceived as a synthon for the assembly of coordination networks.

data.question: Is the synthesis of [Ag2(p-C≡CC6H4C≡C)]n 4 performed under an inert atmosphere of nitrogen?
data.answer: True

data.question: Does the synthesis of compound 2 involve the use of AgCF3CO2 in a concentrated aqueous solution?
data.answer: True

data.question: What is the coordination mode of the ethynide moieties in the crystal structure of compound 3?
data.answer: The ethynide moieties bond to silver atoms via three different coordination modes, μ4-η1,η1,η1,η2, μ4-η1,η1,η2,η2, and μ5-η1,η1,η1,η1,η2, in the crystal structure of compound 3.

data.question: Is the synthesis of [Ag2(o-C≡CC6H4C≡C)]n 6 carried out at room temperature?
data.answer: True
